channel.title: Zoss' Help thread!
channel.description:
[b]What I will help you with[/b] Minor Coding Private server help Any basic help And so on and so forth.
[b][i]What I [u]won't[/u] be helping you with.[/b] Coding whole servers
[b]What'd I'd like as a thank-you[/b] At least a post back saying thanks ;)
I can try to help you really nooby people with starting a server too, so shoot your questions at me! :)
[b][i]Please post which Source you're using, try to use proper grammar and spelling and describe what you need help with![/b]
Thanks to ZeroFreeze for the guide line of this thread. :)

item.title: Zoss' Help thread!
item.dc:creator: @KiIIer KiIIer
item.description:
@KiIIer wrote:

Hey I’m not noobie I’ve been coding for 4-5 months now but I was wondering if you could help me with this. Really isn’t an error or anything. I am useing CheezScape 80 and I need to know how to make the potions drink (I coded all the potions in already made the timers and booleans) I just need to know what to add to make the potions actually drink and not say “Nothing interesting is happening” when I click them. If you could help me with that I thank you very much.

Read full topic

item.title: Zoss' Help thread!
item.dc:creator: @gungamma gungamma
item.description:
@gungamma wrote:

client.java:26806: ';' expected String ItemName = GetItemName(ItemID); ^ client.java:26847: ';' expected f (ItemID == -1) { ^ client.java:26862: illegal start of expression public int GetCLDefence(int ItemID) { ^ client.java:26976: illegal start of expression public PlayerSave loadMythgame(String playerName, String playerP ass) ^ client.java:28854: ';' expected } ^ client.java:28854: '}' expected } ^ 6 errors Press any key to continue . . .

tried adding skill capes, got 3 errors, deleted ended up getting 6!(pimpscape)
if so can you fix the error and tell me how to add those hard skill capes?
i used a tutorial just search for “skill capes” Thanks!

item.title: Zoss' Help thread!
item.dc:creator: @zoss0 Zoss
item.description:
@zoss0 wrote:

Yes sure,
What kind of windows are you using? If Xp: Right click My computer. Click properties. Click Advanced. Click Enviroment varables. Now click the top button “New”. For the name type “Path” (Without quotation marks) Now for the value if you installed the 2 Java’s right and set it to the default path when installing, put this value: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin. Click new again. This time for the name type “CLASSPATH” (Without quotation marks) Now for the value: CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin;%CLASSPATH%;. Click ok, Now try it!

Get JDK And JRE from the java website, if you need links yell for me please.

Read full topic
